definitions.definition: produced or practised without using artificial chemicals

examples.text: The farm went fully organic 20 years ago.

definitions.definition: produced by or from living things

examples.text: Improve the soil by adding **organic matter**.

definitions.definition: relating to chemical compounds that contain carbon and mainly or ultimately come from living things
connected with the organs of the body
consisting of different parts that are all connected to each other

examples.text: the view of society as an organic whole

definitions.definition: happening in a slow and natural way, rather than suddenly

examples.text: the organic growth of overseas markets

wordOrigin: late Middle English: via Latin from Greek organikos ‘relating to an organ or instrument’.
